data.title: Nvidia Among 5 Top Stocks, But Fails To Join Meta Here
data.text: As it gets set to join the Dow, Nvidia stock leads five stocks near buy points, including Cava, Shopify, Vertiv and MercadoLibre. The post Nvidia Among 5 Top Stocks, But Fails To Join Meta Here appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

data.title: Nvidia AI Blueprint makes it easy for any devs to build automated agents that analyze video
data.text: Nvidia announced that its Nvidia AI Blueprint will make it easy for developers in any industry to build AI agents to analyze video and image content.

data.title: Nvidia is replacing Intel on the Dow Jones Industrial Average: Here's why and what that means
data.text: For the second time in 2024, the Dow Jones Industrial Average (INDEXDJX: .DJI) is getting a shakeup. Back in February, Amazon replaced Walgreens on the stock market index.

data.title: Nvidia: King Of AI Getting Pumped Up For More
data.text: Nvidia will soon replace Intel in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, ending INTC's 25-year run of underperformance in the index. NVDA's recent market outperformance suggests investors are getting pumped up for its upcoming earnings release later this month. Recent earnings releases from AMD and Intel show that the King of AI's market leadership remains structurally bullish.

data.title: Investing Groups Digest: Mag 7 In The Market Spotlight
data.text: Seeking Alpha's Investing Group leaders presented their earnings assessments from Mag 7 tech giants. Are investors missing hidden opportunities with BDCs, CEFs, mREITs, and preferreds? The case is made for breaking up Realty Income.

data.title: Nvidia Overtakes Apple as World's Most Valuable Company
data.text: Nvidia (NVDA) shares rose Monday, propelling the AI chip leader into the top spot on the list of the world's most valuable companies.

data.title: Here's what Super Micro's struggles may mean for Nvidia and Dell
data.text: Dell might not see immediate financial benefits, but an analyst thinks customers are paying attention to Super Micro's auditor exit, which could start helping Dell next year.

data.title: AI Titan Nvidia Overtakes Apple As World's Most Valuable Company
data.text: Artificial intelligence kingpin Nvidia became the largest company in the world Monday, surpassing iPhone maker Apple, marking another feather in the cap for the Silicon Valley titan Nvidia.

data.title: Nvidia replaces Intel in Dow Jones index this week
data.text: NVIDIA Corp (NASDAQ:NVDA, ETR:NVD) will replace Intel Corp (NASDAQ:INTC, ETR:INL) in the Dow Jones Industrial Average this week in the latest shake-up of the Wall Street index.  Intel has been one of the DJIA's 30 constituents since 1999, when it and Microsoft became the first companies traded on the Nasdaq exchange to be included as part of the 128-year-old benchmark.

data.title: Nvidia Joins Dow, Replacing Intel as AI Boom Highlights Tech's Growing Market Influence
data.text: Nvidia joins the Dow, replacing Intel in a major AI-driven shift as its market cap soars, reflecting tech's dominance in the stock market.

data.title: CMG Targets Faster Simulation Solutions with NVIDIA Accelerated Computing
data.text: CALGARY, Alberta, Nov. 04, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Computer Modelling Group Ltd. (“CMG” or the “Company”) (TSX: CMG) today announced it is collaborating with NVIDIA to further develop and optimize CMG subsurface simulation solutions for increased speed, performance, and energy efficiency.

data.title: Market value of Nvidia and TSMC surges in October on strong AI chip demand
data.text: Nvidia led a surge in market value among global firms in October, buoyed by unrelenting demand for its new supercomputing artificial intelligence chips as more companies integrate AI into their daily operations.

data.title: SK Hynix rallies 6.5% after Nvidia boss Jensen Huang asks firm to expedite next-generation chip
data.text: Chey Tae-won, chair of SK Group, said Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang asked him if SK Hynix could move the supply of high-bandwith memory (HBM) chips called HBM4 forward by six months. SK Hynix also announced a new 16-layer HBM product.

data.title: Facebook, Nvidia ask US Supreme Court to spare them from securities fraud suits
data.text: The U.S. Supreme Court is set to consider bids by two tech giants - Meta's Facebook and Nvidia - to fend off federal securities fraud lawsuits in separate cases that could make it harder for private litigants to hold companies to account.
